precontext: Tommy was excited as he headed to the park with his dad. He carried his soccer ball tightly under his arm. They found a spot near the benches and prepared for some fun.
ending: Tommy looked forward to showing off his ability to maneuver the ball with his feet.
meanings_considered: let saliva drivel from the mouth
explanation:
• "Dribbling" referring to moving the soccer ball with feet fits perfectly with the precontext of Tommy preparing to play and the ending mentioning maneuvering the ball.  
• The alternative meaning (saliva dripping) is inconsistent with the context of a child excitedly playing soccer and does not align with the physical activity described.  
• There is no indication of Tommy drooling or oral secretions, and the surrounding narrative focuses on physical movement and sports activity.
